title: OpenMPI should not enable PMI by default
body:
I'm building OpenMPI on my OS X laptop. This now fails with:

```
checking if user requested PMI support... yes
checking if PMI support can be built... no
configure: WARNING: PMI support requested (via --with-pmi) but neither pmi.h
configure: WARNING: nor pmi2.h were found under locations:
configure: WARNING:     /usr
configure: WARNING:     /usr/slurm
configure: WARNING: Specified path: yes
configure: WARNING: OR neither libpmi nor libpmi2 were found under:
configure: WARNING:     /usr/lib
configure: WARNING:     /usr/lib64
configure: WARNING: Specified path: 
configure: error: Aborting
```

Apparently PMI requires certain system libraries that are not present on OS X. Could you disable PMI by default?

Alternatively, you could autodetect whether PMI (or InfiniBand) are present, and enable them by default only if that's the case.
